intro: Dictyolimon griffithii, commonly known as the Kashmir chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a cluster of small florets. Dictyolimon griffithii is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
